byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer and Michael Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

snippet: American employers added 103,000 jobs in September, the Labor Department said Friday, indicating that the economy is at least not weakening. The jobless rate held steady at 9.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: American employers added 103,000 jobs in September, the Labor Department said Friday, indicating that the economy is at least not weakening. The jobless rate held steady at 9.1 percent.

headline.main: Adding Jobs, but Not Many, U.S. Economy Seems to Idle
headline.print_headline: Modest Growth In Jobs Tempers Recession Fears
headline.seo: Modest Growth in Jobs Tempers Recession Fears
